snippet: A Brooklyn grand jury found that 19 children died of abuse and neglect because the city’s child protective agency had failed to rigorously investigate cases.
abstract: Brooklyn grand jury finds 19 children in New York City died of abuse and neglect because city's Administration for Children's Services failed to rigorously investigate cases, even after city report recommended new practices in 2007; decision comes during court proceeding for two former caseworkers awaiting trial on charges of criminally negligent homicide in death of 4-year-old Marcella Brett-Pierce.
lead_paragraph: A Brooklyn grand jury found that 19 children died of abuse and neglect because the city’s child protective agency had failed to rigorously investigate cases.

headline.main: Grand Jury Cites Deaths of Children in Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Grand Jury Cites Deaths Of Children In Inquiry
